title: Brgy. Maligaya
description:
Abstract
 Ang tesis na ito ay isang matalinhagang pagtulisa sa kung paano hinuhubog ng isang lipunan, sa pamamagitan ng mga paniniwalang nakagisnan at mga tradisyon, ang kaligayahan ng isang bata. Ipinakikita rin sa pelikulang ito kung paanong ang mga paniniwala at tradisyon na ito ay unti-unting pumapasok sa kamalayan ng bawat bata at isang banda ay nagdidikta kung paano dapat mamuhay, sa kanyang paglaki, kung nais niyang maging maligaya.
 Ang pelikulang ito ay isang ring makahulugang krititismo sa mga kwentong pambata, particular na ang mga fairy tales na literature at pelikula. Sa pagbabasa ng filmmaker ang mga aklat tungkol sa kanila, kanyang natunghayan ang kanilang kasaysayan na nagbukas ang malaking pinto sakabuluhan ng tesis na ito. Pinag-aralan niya rin ang ilang mga fairy tales na isinulat ng magkapatid na Wilhelm at Jacob Grimm at ni Hans Christian Anderson at nalaman, sa tulong pa ring iba pang mg aklat,ang mga konbensyon ng mga fairy tales na literature.
 Akin ring pinag-aralan ang mga animation na gawa ni Walt Disney at ibang pang mga fairy tales sa pelikula upang malaman ang mga kobensyon ng mga fairy tales sa naturang midyum.
 Pinag-aralan niya rin ang mga ito at nakabuo ng isang fairy tale na nagtatanong tungkol sa katotohanan ng “ happily ever after’’ at kung paano ba talaga ito nakukuha o dapat mukha ng isang tao base sa lipunang kanyang kinagagalawan.
subject: SOCIETY IN FILMS, THRILLERS
creator: Seeckts, Shenn Irerick Guillermo
castcrew: Seeckts, Frederick; Sales, Rommel

title: Keep your Tickets for Inspection
description:
Abstract
 
 Keep Your Tickets For Inspection is premised on the normative licensing by class markers," objects/behavior identified with class/lifestyle which influences how people are treated in modern societies. "One against all," people constantly indulge in an act of surveillance of these signs of class in deciding how they would treat the other.
 
 In presenting bus passengers as a metaphor for the silent majority, the film critiques the passivity in everyday life. It experiments on whether frustration, with the push and pull of anxiety brought about by the aggressive dialogue of signs and passivity in the desire for acceptance, can surface a consciousness of the political.
subject: TRANSPORT IN FILMS
creator: Castro, Marella Jem
castcrew: Alarilla, Adrian Ellis; Fernandez, Maria Carmen; Alparce, Sierra Cecilia; Penafiel, Melissa, Fukushima, Erika; Serrano, Patricia

title: Ang Alamatng Kulay
description:
Abstract
 Mallari, M.R.G(2009). Ang Alamat ng Kulay, Student Thesis, University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication. 
  
 Long ago, the earth only had three colors inhabited by three clans representing each. War broke when the three clans sought to have the crystal as the source of color and immoral life. Adeya , from blue can, and Sinukuan, from the red, caught passion for each other, even though love between two of the different kind is forbidden. They went into hiding when the crystal broke into pieces and the earth lost its colors. Meanwhile, Adeya bore three children of disparate colors. Silab was almost re, Agwe, was almost blue but the last one, Bunyan favored by their parents so the elder two became jelous. Silab and Agwe killed Bunyan and through Bunyan’s death, the three colors multiplied back and restored the colors of the earth.
 The film entitled Ang Alamat ng Kulay attempts to have explore the structure of the children’s story in the form of Philippine folklore.
 It seeks to explain where the different colors in the world came from while it shows value of self-sacrifice despite flaws one encounters. The genre of animation was used to further promote these values.
subject: COLOUR
creator: Mallari, Marie Rivelle Garcia
castcrew: Rodrigo, Mikai; Ladignon, Ella Mae; Lualhjati, Paolo; Mallari, Rivelle; Lindaya, Paolo; Magsaysay, Raffy

title: Hindi Sumusuntok sa Hangin
description:
Abstract 
 Alcala, A. I. B. (2009). Hindi Sumusuntok sa Hangin (Not Beating the Air), Student Thesis, University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication.
 This thesis revolves around the analogy between the sport of boxing and the struggles that ordinary people face in their lives. Because boxing is such a popular sport in the Philippines, it serves a fitting metaphoric device in illustrating analogy. Differently people face different kinds of problems which entail different yet nonetheless legitimate ways of overcoming them. This illustrated metaphorically in the film through different boxing styles and other boxing elements. This was done through the story deals with three protagonists: a doctor, a hospital patient and a nurse. The story is set before, during and after the Manny Pacquiao-Oscar de la Hoya match, through boxing parallelisms, the character’s respective conflicts and obstacles are presented.
subject: GAMBLERS IN FILMS, BOXING IN FILMS
creator: Alcala, Ana Iris Braga
castcrew: Soliongco, Caloy; Espia, Hannah; Escueta, Ina; Garcia, Mara; Alcala, Angela

title: Limang Libo
description:
Abstract
 Idanan, A.J. R. (2009). Limang Libo, Student Thesis, University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication. 
 
 “Limang Libo” is a film about two people who live separate lives and are unaware of each other’s existence. The two characters are Susan and Manuel, both her husband and son, and is bound to her debts. Manuel on the other hand, is a scavenger at a city dump site who lives with his eight-month pregnant wife. Their paths cross due to an unfavorable accidents risking the lives of Manuel’s wife and unborn child. He takes his family to Susan’s house, letting her take charge of the whole situation. Faced with unfortunate circumstances, both Susan and Manuel will be forced to act against their instincts.
 The film relays an important message that the people, when challenged by situations brought to them by society, are sometimes forced to act against their natural behavior in order to survive. These decisions, which tend to be done rashly and without contemplation, greatly affects not only their own lives but also the ones of those around them.
subject: SOCIETY IN FILMS, CRIME IN FILMS
creator: Idanan, Aiza Jane Rimas
castcrew: Lupac, Maita Lirra; Espia, Hannah; Habac, Jaime Jr.; Idanan, Norman

title: Pigil Hininga
subject: WORKERS IN FILMS
creator: Padilla, Abijoyce
castcrew: Garcia, Richmond, Garcia, Sol, Yap, Jumar; Manatad, Carlo Francisco; Naguit, Nani

title: Prodigy
description:
Abstract
 Prodigy is a 20-minute narrative film on digital video using P2 technology. It tells the story about father and son who will reconcile their differences through music. 
 This films integrates sound as the motivation of the story. Music serves as the main dialogue of film. The use of jazz helps the characters release their emotions and express themselves. Through music, they find harmony. 
 It is stated in Baudrillard's Theory of Hyperreality, "the moment modernity exploded upon us is the moment of liberation in every sphere; and the only thing we can do after liberation has been achieved is to simulate that liberation." In this film, the almost endless production of memories has brought liberation to the person who owns these memories.
subject: MUSICIANS IN FILMS
creator: Pornela, Crystal
castcrew: Cabigon, Chad; Ramos, Franne Cheska; Clamor, Tey; Perez, Andice Marie; Manaatad, Carlo Francisco; Araneta, Miko

title: Alam mo Yung Ganun (Alam mo 'yung ganun? sa TUKLAS)
description:
Abstract
 
 
 
 Go. G.T (2009) Alam mo yung ganon?. Unpublished Undergraduate thesis University of the Philippine College of Mass Communication 
 
 “Alam mo yung ganon?” aside from being the title of this film is a question that is thrown around a lot. It is a question that simplify ask for understanding. It is used when in need of someone relate to one’s situation. It is seeking for assurance that one is not alone. The through is, most often that not people are not looking for answer to their problems but someone just to listen and tell them that they know what one is talking about. And this, simplify is the intention of the film.
 
  The film is about specific group of young and privilege Filipinos who are all still trying to figure out what to do to their lives after college. It basically fallow a day of a life of Mara as she goes to her classes and hung out with their friends. It is more than anything a youth film. It appears to be a personal film but if is more of the story of my friends than it is mine 
 
 Sigfried Kracauer’s Theory of realism and jean twenge’s generation of me are the main theories’ are used in the framework.
creator: Go, Bebe
castcrew: Garcia, Richmond, Garcia, Sol, Roxas, Gerry;

title: Numbalik diwa ang Lumalabong Gunitang Lumang Ako
description:
Abstract
 Numbalikdiwa literally means ”return of the subconscious’’. The translation of the Filipino word diwa inherently comes from the series of discussions presented by Virgilio Enriquez in From Colonial to Liberation Psychology(1994). The proponent express great interest in the study and observation of people and varied process of thinking. Consequently, having read an array of essays and journals on the contentious study of the human subconscious, it is deemed generally interesting and provocative to experiment on the visualization of such. On the level of personal interpretation and the general limitations of this proposal, Numbalikdiwa ought to mean “the generic consciousness revisualized.’’ 
 The film is the proponent’s sixteen-minute attempt to visualize the Filipino subconscious through an emblem of a lethargic old man losing hope in the brink of demise. He finds false compassion from the different personas with three different intentions one entertains, one empathize. What is left of his capacity to save his own subconscious (diwa) is hindered by a personal battle to realize who or what to believe.
 Guiding this film are Virgilio Enriquez’s theory of Liberation Psychology and Jacques Derrida’s Deconstruction.
subject: AGED IN FILMS
creator: Garcia, Richmond Barlam
castcrew: Clamor, Tey; Navarrete ; Diszon; Rabadam;

title: SantaKrusan
description:
Abstract
 Santacruzan is a festivity to commemorate Queen Helena’s Search for the Holy Cross. It is a mixture of beauty pageant and procession but is different from the former two. The film Santacruzan reenacts the journey of woman from pain and loss towards happiness and conviction. The ’santacruzan’ itself is a journey of a young woman wearing a beautiful gown with their incomparable display of grace and confidence.
 The thesis entitled Santacruzan is a 20-minutes experimental film shot on digital video using P2 technology. The film illustrates a night in a life of a single mother who works a club dancer to make a living for her, her mother and her young daughter. The film explores the ability of a woman in the process of becoming- complex, enigmatic and beautiful. She with pain loss, yet committed to dealing with such hardship in life with courage, love and grace.
subject: PROSTITUTES IN FILMS
creator: Yap, Jumar
castcrew: Baptista-Kiso, Marlyn; Dizon, Peter Edward; Baldemor, Monique; Clamor, Tey

title: Be Fabulous: the Guide to a“Better” new you
subject: BEAUTY IN FILMS
creator: Fernandez, Joan Rose C.
castcrew: Sales, Rommel; Alcazaren, Whammy; Baban, Jesse Rey Logrosa

title: Bottled Star
description:
Abstract
 
 Bottled Star takes as its subject the concept and practice of escapism in the modern age. Escapism is the practice of distancing yourself from the immediate present and seeking refuge in something else. Today, it has evolved to take on a multitude of forms and methods. We are offered so many ways to seek refuge from our problem through television, film, alcohol, and, most notoriously, the Internet. All of these can combine to form a more potent blindfold than religion. However, the relief these things
 Provide can keep people functional. And in fact fuel today’s capitalist society like a cycle of addiction and purchase.
 
  Indulging in escapism always comes with the possible effect of becoming out of touch with reality, and out of touch with other people. This thesis film portrays people surrounding themselves with commodified dreams and items that they do not really need, and these things blind them from seeing what the world has offer. Today’s economic and system readily provides us with multiple avenues of illusory happiness continuous stream until we become dependent upon them for what we believe to be our peace of mind.

creator: Crisostomo, Mikki
castcrew: Soliongco, Caloy

title: Casa De Los Ninos (Casa De Los Ninos sa TUKLAS)

title: Dadi
description:
Abstract
 
 Malsi, I.B. (2010) Dadi. Unpublished Undergraduate Thesis, University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication.
 
 This undergraduate thesis explores the concepts of memory decline, aging, and loss through a short film framed by the Narrative Theory of film, Cognitive Identification and Empathy in film, Realism, and the functions of the cinematic look or gaze.
 
 The filmmaker uses the poetics of the short film in the creation of a narrative that explores the affect of film language on engaging empathy in the spectator.
subject: AGED IN FILMS
creator: Malsi, Lisa Nastassja Banquilla
castcrew: Malsi, Josefina; Malsi, Domingo Jr; Malso, Domingo Sr.; Aquino, Joy Bernadette; Lumibao, Noel

title: Pikit ng Alaala (Slumberofmemories) (Pikit ng alaala sa TUKLAS)
description:
Abstract
 
 Rapanut, J. P. (2010). Pikit ng Alaala, Unpublished Undergraduate Thesis, University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication.
 
 This film is about the generation and degeneration of a person's memories. Memories can be reincarnated again in various ways. In this film, memories are given second life in the form of still pictures. The story takes place mainly in the mind of a woman, who gathers so much experiences throughout her life. In the end, she will get old and become forgetful, but will be able to preserve her memories by the pictures she has taken. Her time may pass and her human mind may weaken; but thanks to her photographs, her memories will stay. It is stated in Baudrillard's Theory of Hyperreality, "the moment modernity exploded upon us is the moment of liberation in every sphere; and the only thing we can do after liberation has been achieved is to simulate that liberation." In this film, the almost endless production of memories has brought liberation to the person who owns these memories. It becomes a repetitive cycle, and somewhat senseless. As the person who owns the memories get old and eventually die, the endless cycle of repetition is put to an end. As a redeeming factor, it is not all put to an end. The real meaning of those memories still survives, as photographs; it's essence simulated by those who see it.
subject: AGED IN FILMS
creator: Rapanut, Jenelyn Padron
castcrew: Rapanut, Adrian; Cayabyab, Krina; Barua, Gary; Herradura, Juarde

title: Man of the House
subject: FAMILY IN FILMS, HUMAN RELATIONS IN FILM
creator: Hipol, Chuck
castcrew: Lupac, Maita Lirra; Barrozo, Teresa; Baco, King Mark; Mallari, Rivelle; Cabral, Jeff

title: De-constructing Eve
description: The issue of patriarchy and gender inequality has been an ongoing issue since time immemorial. Several studies and productions have been made in order to address the issue, but it is always good to further dabble in the topic because of its prevalence in most societies. (De)constructing Eve is an experimental film which aims to show that while men construct the identity of women and eventually destroy them through their distorted perception of who and what they are, it is the major responsibility of women to correct this false identity dictated by the patriarchal system and reconstruct their rightful identity according to their own perception and value systems. In an attempts to show this, the thesis production focused on showing how men construct the identity of women and in doing so, also destroys them in the process, through imagery and sound. The thesis also gives a glimpse as to what women can do in their existing situation in society - to take the responsibility of rebuilding their own identities. To further examine the concept, the thesis discusses the plight of women both in society and in film.
subject: HUMAN RELATIONS IN FILM
creator: Buenaflor, Erika
castcrew: Buenaflor, Jaime; Buenaflor, Maria Lourdes; Buenaflor, Erika; Penafiel, Aissa

title: Ikatatlumpung Kaarawan ni Susan
description:
Abstract
 
 Aujero, R.A.P. (2010). Ikatatlumpung Kaarawan ni Susan. Unpublished Undergraduate Thesis. University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication
 
 The film ikatatlampung Kaarawan ni Susan is about the struggle of a woman with the image constructs of society. Susan is turning thirty and the pressures of marriage and career are both present with her persistent mother and her work at the office. She finds herself immobilized in between these two extremes.
 
 It seems that the only obvious choices available to women in society are family or career. But in fact, there are - and should be more defining choices in life for a woman. It is now up to Susan to decide to choose and conform to what society dictates of her.
subject: HUMAN RELATIONS IN FILM
creator: Aujero,Rochele Anne Palabrica
castcrew: Arenillo, Krista Mae; Camelo, Kim; Lee, Samantha; Cabangis, Aaron; Aujero, Rochel; Soliongco, Caloy; Mesina, aleli

title: Panagtagpo sa Akong mga Apohan  (Panagtagpo sa akong mga apohan (The Day my grandmothers met) sa TUKLAS
description:
Abstract
 Camporedondo, P.M.B. (2010). Ang Panagtagbo sa akong mga Apohan (The Day my Grandmothers Met), Unpublished Undergraduate Thesis, University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication.
 The film is a glimpse of the history of an old religion called the Equifrilibricum World Religion, also known as the Moncadista. The filmmaker interviews her grandmother and the elder women members, shedding light to the once obscure religion and at the same time underscoring the mystery behind their faith. The elders recall their experiences, their practices, and personal struggle with the religion after their families migrated to Samal Island from different parts of the Philippines after World War II.
 The recorded narrative becomes a visual and oral history of the Moncadista members who were one of the first settlers in the island, which is situated in the Davao Gulf. The film develops into a personal act of understanding the filmmaker's Moncadista ancestors and as well as discerning her own identity as a Filipina.
 The film uses postmodern theories particularly Post feminism and the indigenous psychology (Sikolohiyang Pilipino) that caters to the marginal women of color who define the self and community through personal relationships and indigenous spirituality.
subject: AGED IN FILMS
creator: Camporedondo, Pete Malaya
castcrew: Camporedondo, Malaya; De Guia, Kabunyan;
link: 2010_PanagtagposaAkongmgaApohan  (Panagtagpo sa akong mga apohan (The Day my grandmothers met) sa TUKLAS

title: Maglilili
subject: FANTASY IN FILMS
creator: Aquino, Laurice Dungca
castcrew: Baful, Carla Marie; Cardoz, Michael christian; Gonzales, Paolo; Magno, Sandino

title: Paghahati
description:
Abstract
 
 Ignacio, R. E. (2010). Paghahati, Unpublished Undergraduate Thesis, University of the Philippines, College of Mass Communication.
 
 People have basic needs in order to survive. But gone are the days that people are just concerned with survival. People have grown accustomed to having more than what's needed. They don't accumulate to have something just in case something bad will happen in the future. They accumulate for the sake of having more. In society, having more of what most people need is the same as having power over them.
 
 "Paghahati" is not just a story of dividing assets and having more than what the other is having. But it is a story of how greed and self-centeredness destroys a person's humanity (pagkatao) and his/her relationships with other people,
 
 In physics, it is said that in every action there is an opposite reaction. My film explores the repercussions of greed that people neglect due to their desire to have more. Since the effects are not seen physically, let the film bring you and show you what can be if you share the same greediness as the film's characters.
subject: HUMAN RELATIONS IN FILM
creator: Ignacio, Rene Ela P.
castcrew: Olympia, Adrian Solomon, Habac, Jaypee Jr.; Cabigan, Chad; Alandy, Joe; Mortel, Frances Grace; Valenzuela, Regina; Lavalle, Rene Ela P.

title: Senyalez
description:
Abstract
 
 Elloso, Ma. Fatima Aiza Mamasig. "Senyalez" BA thesis. University of the Philippines Diliman College of Mass Communication, 2010.
 Lesbians are a very rare sight in Philippine cinema. In the few films where there is a lesbian character, she is almost always shown as an unattractive, bad-mannered "tomboy" (butch lesbian) who likes to pick fights. She would also probably have vices like smoking, drinking and doing drugs. More often than not, she would also have a "straight" girl as love interest, who in the end will leave her for a "true" man. Either that or she gets raped and becomes a "real" woman.
 "Senyalez" seeks to divert from such negative portrayals and tragic story lines. It aims to break and go beyond the stereotypes by portraying lesbians in a positive light. It also makes use of camp and anime influences, as opposed to the usual dark and "realistic" approach in stereotypical lesbian films.
subject: GENDER AND THE CINEMA, HUMAN RELATIONS IN FILM
creator: Elloso, Ma. Fatima Aiza Mamasig
castcrew: Garcia, Sol; Araneta, Miguel; Jamilano, Mark Angelo; Lachica, Daniel Jr.; Vigilia, Sam; Gonzales, Richard

title: Si Maya at ang Mundo
description:
Abstract
 
 Si Maya at Mundo tells the story of Maya as the completes in school beauty pageant, Miss United Nations 2009. She represents the Philippines in the pageant and competes with five other contestants representing other countries as well.
 
 Si Maya at Mundo is a fourteen-minute narrative film that presentation a moment in the life of a grade school student, Maya Cruz, wherein she joins a school activity. This film also presents Maya’s moment in her life when her father had to leave the courage for an overseas job.
 
 The film explores the sacrifice of a family and the leaving family member have to undergo because of migrations. This film also explores the relationship between globalization and migration through the Miss United Nations.
 
 This film learns on the theory of Realism. This film also applies the Push-Pull theory and the Rational Choice Theory.
subject: BEAUTY IN FILMS
creator: Escueta, Rachel; Marinela, Estrella
castcrew: Jose, Luigina; Canbangis, Aaron; Yap, Jumar; De Rivera, Jono; Pineda, Jan; Manatad, Carlo;

title: Canon983
description:
Abstract 
 
 After years of serving peacefully Feather Bautista moves to another parish where he is reminded of the old times and of old friends.
 
 Danny Cortez, a friend from Father Bautista’s youth welcomes him to the community with his family. Soon a scandal surrounding the Cortez family surfaces, Father Bautista finds out that Danny’s picture perfect family life may not be as picturesque as it seems.
 
 Being the only person who knows the details through sacrament of confession, Father Bautista chooses between saving a friend and fulfilling the vow he is bound to.
 
 The Canon 983 states that the sacramental seal is inviolable even if it means their death and the death of others. Violating the rule means excommunication from the church. 
 
 The confessional has always been a place where troubled souls, people go to share their problems. It is where they unload whatever is bothering them and a place where they generally receive some form of enlightenment from their worries.
 
 The film looks at how the confessional sometimes goes against its original design. If its main purpose is to help people, in this film it looks at how the rule becomes the reason as to how a priest can become powerless when certain problems arise. 
 
 
 The Law becomes the reason as to why our main character becomes paralyzed when it comes to helping his friends who come to the confessional. The system gives limitation on doing something good and gives emotional burden to the confessor.
subject: PRIESTS IN FILMS, FAMILY IN FILMS, HUMAN RELATIONS IN FILM
creator: Darunday, Marjorie J.
castcrew: Delos Reyes, Joseph; Evangelio, Jojo; Sales, Rommel; cardoz, Michael Christian; Habac, Jaime Jr.; Cabigon, Chad Angelic

title: Hinagapat at Gunita
description:
Abstract 
 “Hinagap at Gunita,” a loose adaption of Paz Marquez Benitez’s “Dead Stars” and Edith Wharton’s The Age of Innocence, tells the story of Julia Salazar, A woman who relives the past forty years of her life through rooms containing her memories, Julia revisits an old affair, one that occurred right before her marriage. For a long time, the affair has repeatedly haunted Julia, as the man she had it with was her husband’s brother, Alejandro. However, as she goes through her other-memories those that occurred during her marriage, her quiet days with her husband, Alfredo, and their son-Julia realizes that perhaps her short-lived affair does not really mean as much as she once thought it did.
 
 The film functions as counter-memory by retelling pieces of Philippine history not through the convention of history books, but through the perspective of an ordinary person representative of millions of others who are often considered peripheral to the more traditional narrations of our country’s history.
creator: Santos, Jaimee
castcrew: Perez, Candice Marie; Baco, King Mark; Cabral, Jefferson, Santiago, Cristina; Munos, Toni

title: Hungkag
subject: CRIME IN FILMS
creator: Manatad, Carlo Francisco Yanuario
castcrew: Esquivel, Jimico Piccole; Perez, Candice Marie; Baco, King Mark; Yap, Jumar

title: Idlip
description:
Abstract
 Idlip is a thirteen-minute film that speaks of a child’s dream of obtaining the simple joy of childhood. It tells the story, traverses from the bitter cold world of reality to the warm world of fantasy and dreams.
 Inspired by the one of the most tragic fairytales, the film follows the story of The Little Match Girl by Hans Christian Andersen. Set in a modern Filipino setting. Idlip is a reinterpretation and a real life translation of this great fairytale that has long been written, forgotten and remained unheard by many. As an adaptation, the structure of the film remains truthful to the original story but some elements were altered to suit the idea of a modern-day Filipino setting.
 “An old story, retold.” Idlip aims to relieve the message of the classic fairytale by presenting it through the world more familiar to us.
subject: SOCIETY IN FILMS, WORKERS IN FILMS
creator: Rabadam, Loren Jane
castcrew: Garcia, Richond; Baco, King Mark; Cabral, Jefferson; De Guzman, Reign; Padilla, Abijoyce; Manatad, Carlo Francisco

title: Ricochet
description:
Abstract
 
 Cabigon, Chad Angelic Duque. Ricochet. University of the Philippines Diliman. College of Mass Communication, 2010. Unpublished Undergraduate Thesis.
 Ricochet tells the story of a man who contemplates on a murder he committed. His plan
 
 to restore peace and to avenge his misfortune backfires when he kills an innocent man instead of a scoundrel. It narrates the story of a man dealing with his inner purgatory and the psychological death of his humanity.
 
 The film is about the repercussions of man's thoughts and actions in accordance to the people around him. We may have the best intentions but we may not have the proper solutions. When chaos arises we could possibly create more tribulations than resolutions, and with that we struggle to remain our sanity intact while trying to cover our sins.
 
 The film also highlights the technical capabilities of the medium in order to expressively communicate with its audience. It tries to be self-reflexive on the use of film as a medium to share new meanings not just those that were readily presented in the film as it exemplified concepts of Linda Hutcheon's theory on Metafiction (Hutcheon 2).
subject: CRIME IN FILMS
creator: Cabigon, Chad Angelic D.
castcrew: Cabigon, Phoebe; Bernal, Joyce; Camarillo, Catherine; Lavalle, Evy Rose; Mortel, Frances; Ignacio, Ela

title: 22:19 (Veintedos : Diez y Nueve)
subject: CULT FILMS
creator: Jose, Luigina Mari Paez
castcrew: De Rivera, Jono; Cabangis, Aaron; Manalaysay, Mico; De Guzman, Reign Anne; Perez, Candice Marie; Lansigan, Raiza

title: Hapibertdei
description: Hapi Bertdei is about celebration of the 8th birthday of a little girl and the way her mother is celebrating it. Approached with a long take technique, it starts with the mother going home from work and goes on doing her after work routine. At first, we see the little girl cheering up her mother as she does her routine with a tired stature. What comes to mind is that the girl is an ignored child, She blabbers away about what happened at school, about the people she met and food she ate that day, and at some point compares herself to how she was when she was sick. Towards the middle, we realize that this girl seemed to have survived an ordeal of being terminally ill, but upon getting to the end, it is revealed that the child is just a ghost; she had actually already died before her 8th birthday
subject: HUMAN RELATIONS IN FILM, FAMILY IN FILMS
creator: Alvarez, Erika Kristi

title: Over Time
subject: BASKETBALL IN FILMS
creator: Blacer, Pia & Mao Ragotero
castcrew: Ferrer, Benjo; Aguinaldo, Hyro; Manatad, Carlo Francisco; Cruz, Ber Carlo; Rabadam, Loren

title: Laya
description: "Grief, coming so rarely but being so intricate and connected to so many things in our life, appears mysterious and uncanny at first until we realize that its grounded in reality that we must delve deeper to discover. Grief is seductive, immersive, distracting and backward looking; however, it is possible to explore it yet still remain unscathed if one seeks to truly understand it and, in some ways, embrace it. This thesis is about the journey of a man through grief toward acceptance of the loss of a loves one through a narrative film. The film manifests both imagery and words that re-present and represents how the protagonist, Emil, deals with the death of his wife and how a folkloric mystical figure, Laya, helps him through his grief and misery toward acceptance and moving forward."
subject: EMOTION IN FILMS
creator: Catbagan, Bianca
castcrew: Palomares, Sasha; Araneta, Miguel; Barrios, Louie; Lee Samantha

title: 3Four
description: 3four is a film set in the future, it was that distinct lullaby that will bring the boy to his past, to his source.
subject: FUTURISM AND THE CINEMA
creator: de Leon, Tabel
castcrew: Vargas, Maria Rita; Damaso, Patricia Angeli; Mortel, Frances Grace; Habac, Jaime Jr.; Montero, Trisha Allysse

title: Austria2011
description: "Families have the unique position of serving as links between individuals and the larger society. It is through the family's functions of reproduction, biological and psychological support, and training for social participation and citizenship, that society is able to elicit from an individual his contribution. (Taylor, 1997). Families are also unique in providing continuity of social life. It is major agent in the transmission of culture, political and societal awareness and class consciousness. (Taylor, 1997). A story of consanguinity, disconnection and frivolity, Austria 2011 follows the contemporary bourgeois Austria clan during their reunion as they are left enmeshed in a web of self-inflicted pain and pretense. It is primarily a story of personal issues, old wounds and news revelation, while also a commentary on the superficiality of the bourgeois culture and a confirmation of the universal truth that, bittersweet as it may seem, family conflicts defy social class."
subject: HUMAN RELATIONS IN FILM, FAMILY IN FILMS
creator: Blanco, Angeli Jane Aspiras
castcrew: Blanco, Wany; Blanco, Raidis; Cruz, Berhil

title: Alarm
description:
Abstract
 Pascual, J.L. (2011). Alarm, Unpublished Undergraduate Thesis, University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication.
 Alarm explores the concepts of dreaming and reality. Dreaming is shown to help release repressed desires and frustrations, but also lead to confusion between dream and reality, when the dream becomes more real than waking life. The framework for this narrative is Freud's Psychoanalytic Theory of Dreams, which discusses how dreams and the unconscious are connected. In his book The Interpretation of Dreams, Freud wrote that are "...disguised fulfillments of repressed wishes." Central to this film is that idea- that maybe, when one's desires are too strong and too bottled up, dreams begin to encroach upon reality and blur the line between the two.
subject: WORKERS IN FILMS, SURREALISM AND THE CINEMA
creator: Pascual, Joseph
castcrew: Pascual, Victor; Pascual, Jacqueline; Pascual, Joseph

title: Claudioismo
description:
Abstract
 Lim, Khamille (2011). Claudioismo, Unpublished Undergraduate Thesis, University of the Philipppines, College of Mass Communication.
 This film is a mockumentary revolving around a fictional rockstar-worshipping religion called Claudioismo in the village of Cataggaman, in Tuguegarao. The events of the film all take place in one day, on the eve of what the Claudioistas believe to be Claudio's second coming, or judgment day, which is recorded by a filmmaker who is determined to prove the Claudioistas' beliefs wrong, while making them look as absurd as possible in the process.
 Central to the film's framework is social constructionism, which believes truths to be socially constructed products of culture and history. Claudioismo is an examination of a local myth that dominates the lives of the people of the barangay of Cataggaman, from the point of view of a skeptical and condescending filmmaker-within-the-film. In doing so, the film aims to the idea of question religion, its traditions and organization, as well as its most extreme critics.
subject: MUSICIANS IN FILMS, CULT FILMS
creator: Lim, Khamille
castcrew: Tan, Hazel; Fabros, Bea; Grande, Phyllis; Gorospe, Rizzi; Lorenzo, Leandro

title: Kuwerdas
description:
Abstract
 
 Barretto, J.D. (2011). Kuwerdas, Unpublished B.A. Thesis, University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication
 This production thesis explores the story of the reconciliation of a broken relationship between a has-been acoustic singer mother and her college graduating son. The theoretical framework behind this story is based on two theories of communication and interpersonal relationships. First, the Relational Patterns of Interaction of the Palo Alto Group (1954) states that when two people communicate with each other, they define their relationship based on the way they interact. One has to look at the pattern of behavior between partners over time-how they respond to one another. Second, the Relational Schemas in the Family theory of Fitzpatrick and Koerner (2002, 2006) states that there are relational schemas in which families operate on. According to the theory, a schema is an organized set of memories that you make use of whenever you interact with people. Family members have a certain set of memories that they use as basis when interacting with each other.
 
 In this thesis, we see the mother and son as two persons that strive to make a renewed sense of family despite the circumstances they're faced with. New patterns, new schemes, and new memories have to be formed to hopefully bring back what was lost.
subject: MUSICIANS IN FILMS
creator: Barretto, Chico
castcrew: Umali, Tin, Puyat, Nikki; Manalaybay, Mico; Cabaclang, Maxinl; Bautista, Cyril; Gomez, Maika

title: Lokasyon sa Dislokasyon
description:
Abstract
 
 De Guzman, K.D. (2011). Lokasyon sa Dislokasyon, Unpublished Undergraduate Thesis, Unibersidad ng Pilipinas Diliman Kolehiyo ng Pangmadlang Komunikasyon
 
 Ito ay tungkol sa buhay at pakikibaka ng mga residente sa relocation sites sa perspektiba ng isang lokal na organisasyon, ang SARA (San Andres Relocatees Association) sa kasagsagan ng kanilang paghahanda para sa pagdalo sa pagkilos sa Ikalawang SONA (State of the Nation Address) ng pangulong Noynoy Aquino, Ang SARA ay organisasyon ng mga relocatee mula sa San Andres, Manila na walong taon nang naninirahan sa Kasiglahan Village 1, isang relocation site na matatagpuan sa Brgy. San Jose, Rodriguez, Rizal.
 
 Ito ay hindi lamang simpleng pagsilip sa kanilang aping kalagayan kung hindi, higit sa lahat, pagsipat sa kung paano tinutuntong muli nilang mga itinaboy ang kanilang puwang sa lipunan sa pamamagitan ng pakikibaka para sa kanilang mga karapatan. Subalit katulad ng paglalakbay at pag-ayon sa bagong kinalalagyan, masalimuot din ang proseso ng paglaban. Gayunpaman, ipinipakita dito na hangga't may dayalogo at tunggalian, posible ang paglaban at pagbabago.
subject: SOCIETY IN FILMS
creator: De Guzman, Katheline Daena B.
castcrew: Cielo, Carlo; Castillo, Kenneth

title: Sirip
description:
Abstract
 
 Camelo, K.B. (2010) Sirip, Unpublished Undergraduate Thesis, University of the Philippines - Diliman,
 
 Sirip is about the brief encounters of a little girl and the town outcast, known to the townspeople to be an Aswang (witch). The two developed a friendship, which is rooted from their yearning of belongingness-the little girl is trying to find her mother, the outcast connects with the child. As they finally understood their situation, the little girl's curiosity leads her to find out about a past she shares with the outcast.
 
 The use of the concept of Aswang in the film is to antagonize prevailing social control mechanisms present in the hostility towards outcasts. The film takes on a horror story not about Aswang or witches, but of the real monsters that social norms have hidden deep into the perception of the community.
subject: RELIGION IN FILMS
creator: Camelo, Kim Buban
castcrew: Figuerres, Kim; Malsi, Ilsa; Cabangis, Aaron; Alandy, Joenathan

title: The Arduous search for solace with paintbrush in hand
description: The Arduous Search for Solace with Paintbrush in Hand tackles contemporary themes such as alienation, dreams, and self-actualization, and tries to paint a picture of the disillusioned artist in society. In the present capitalist-driven society, the "real" world, also known as the corporate world, is where people compete with each other to try to make ends meet. The corporate world becomes the battleground for survival, where reaching the top of the corporate ladder is tantamount to success. Along with that, we, through different forms of media, are fed with images that serve as standards for beauty, sexuality and success. Those who veer away from those standards and ideals are looked down upon. As a result, they isolate themselves and try to find their own niche somewhere else. Majority of these deviant members of society are artists. Non-conformists are propelled to seek escape from what reality offers them. In the film, dreams serve as a venue for escapism, allowing the dreamer, Vincent, to be absorbed with the possibilities unachieved in the waking world. The quest for maximizing one's potential, achieving success, peace of mind and happiness is a common goal shared by every member of society. It is doubly arduous for the socially rejected, but never impossible.
subject: ARTISTS IN FILMS
creator: Portillo, Samantha Anne Lazaro & Marxie Maolen Forlales Fadul
castcrew: Mallari, Rivelle; Fronda, April; Amar, Jether; Razon, Jethro; Morales, Jerome; Ignacio, Nono

title: Brownout sa neighborhood namin that day
description:
Abstract
 
 Figuerres, J.D.E. (2011) Brownout sa Neighborhood namin That Day. Unpublished
 
 Undergraduate Thesis, University of the Philippines, College of Mass Communication
 
 This undergraduate thesis explores the boredom and hypocrisy of the middle- class and how repressive the middle-class lifestyle is. The narrative of the film is framed by Surrealism. Dreams as Wish Fulfillment and Sikolohiyang Pilipino (Filipino Psychology). The idiosyncratic manner in which the Filipino middle-class deals with particular family issues serves as context for the film's story. The middle-class setting plays an important role on the behavior of the characters of the film.
subject: CHRISTMAS IN FILMS, DREAMS IN FILMS
creator: Figuerres, Judd
castcrew: Figuerres, Edgar; Figuerres, Perla

title: Winner winner
description:
Abstract
 Cappal, D. J. S. (2011), Winner Winner, Unpublished Undergraduate Thesis, University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication.
 
 In a patron-client society influenced greatly by religion, people involved are either struggling or abiding with these forces governing them just to survive daily living. "Winner Winner" is the story of how the elite gains from the poverty of the majority. Framed by criticism, it explores how Christianity is being used by the powerful in order to drive the powerless to depend more on them.
 
 This production thesis, set in the Philippine Lenten season, ensues a day in a life of a loving mother who joins the popular game show, "Winner Winner," in the hope of redeeming her daughter's corpse from the morgue.
subject: SOCIETY IN FILMS, GAMES IN FILMS
creator: Cappal, Jaise
castcrew: Sanchez-Stachecki, Analyn; Blanco, Geli; Grande, Phyllis; Manatad, Carlo Francisco, Cruz, Ber; Jose, Luigina Mari

title: Agos (UPFI best thesis AY 2010-2011)
description:
Abstract
 
 Lee, S. (2011), Agos, Unpublished Undergraduate Thesis, University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication.
 
 Agos is a documentary about surfer Mocca Eduzma who lives in Bagasbas Camarines Norte. It follows her as she goes about her daily life, fulfilling different roles like being a lifeguard, a surfer, a mentor and a mother. It aims to go beyond the typical images of ther relaxed, easygoing, no-cares surfing lifestyle while at the same time exploring its fundamental values like perseverance and passion.
 
 Claire Johnston once said that "woman as woman is largely absent" when talking about the portrayal of women in cinema. (Johnston, 1975) Agos portrays its subject in such a way where she is completely in charge of the decisions and actions she undertakes, independent of the male figure. It presents Mocca in her natural element, not as a reflection of man, or as an object of desire.
subject: HUMAN RELATIONS IN FILM
creator: Lee, Samantha
castcrew: Lee, Sammy; Lee, Nenett; Figuerres, Judd; Idanan, Ice; Lee, Samantha; Soliongco, Coloy

title: D'Osom (D osom 2 sa TUKLAS)
description:
Abstract
 
 Perez, C. M. V. (2011). D Osom 2, Unpublished Undergraduate Thesis, University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication.
 
 D Osom 2 is a story that revolves around siblings, Masi and Maya. It tells about a young boy, Masi, whose childhood experience drastically changed his simple and hopeful perception of the world. He uses his vivid imagination as his coping mechanism to the longing and worry he feels brought by the uncertainty of where their parents are. Their parents went to a medical mission and cannot be found after. He shares this story to his younger sister Maya to comfort her from the same feeling he has towards their family's circumstance.
 
 Masi creates this superhero story where their parents are the lead superheroes fighting against the "Bad Mamaws" in the land which he named "Kaboomlandia." He labelled the awesome tandem of their superhero parents as "D Osom 2."
 
 The filmmaker believes that it is best for every boys and girls to experience the most out of their childhood. Let them play, laugh, cry, and discover what this world could offer. We, the adults, must protect every child's concept of simple and colorful world, and strategically combine this whole picture to the "reality" of the world.
subject: FAMILY IN FILMS, POLITICAL FILMS
creator: Perez, Candice Marie V.
castcrew: Cappal, Jaise; Santiago, Cristina; Cruz, Berhil Carlo; Cabral, Jefferson; Llona, Mark Joseph; Manatad, Carlo Francisco

title: Sa Pagsapit ng ika-labingwalo
description: This undergraduate thesis explores the concept of monstrosity in the society, deconstruction of family structure and fear of life and death as causes of the limitedness of man as a human being. It is framed by the Monster theory, the Mythological theory, and the theory of Psychoanalysis, with the concept of the archetypes. Through the function of surrealism embedded in the narrative, the storytelling becomes nonlinear, with the past merging with the present, implying more on the characters' self-characterization.
subject: HUMAN RELATIONS IN FILM
creator: Grande, Phyllis Grae B.
castcrew: (unreadable credits)

title: Working while in class
description:
Abstract
 
 Calapardo, Macvelyn d.Q. (2011) Unpublished Undergraduate Thesis. Unibersidad ng Pilipinas Kolehiyo ng Komunikasyong Pangmadla.
 
 Ang Working While in Class ay isang awtobiograpikal na dokumentaryo ng direktor base sa kanyang buhay bilang isang working student. Matapos ang anim na taong pinagsasabay ang pag-aaral at paghahanap-buhay ay naiisipan nang umalis sa kumpanyang pinagtatrabahuhan. Nais na niyang pasukin ang karerang gusto ngunit hindi magawa dahil sa kawalan ng diploma. Hindi magiging madali ang desisyong ito dahil sa ilang mga bagay na kailangang isaalang-alang tulad ng mga bayarin sa kolehiyo at ang kanyang responsibilidad sa pamilya. Sinikap niyang alamin ang magiging kasagutan mula sa pamilya at mga kaibigan, ngunit sa huli ay nasa kanya pa rin ang pagdedesisyon.
subject: AUTOBIOGRAPHY AND THE CINEMA, STUDENTS IN FILMS
creator: Calapardo, Maevelyn de Quiroz
castcrew: Montano, Elroy; Faustino, Lauren Sevilla; Calaguio, Ronnel;

title: Galimgim (UPFI best thesis AY 2010-2011)
description:
Abstract
 
 Santiago, C.S. (2011) Galimgim, Unpublished Undergraduate Thesis, University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication.
 
 "Galimgim" tells the story of a young couple, Gabriel and Agnes, and how their individual choices alter both their lives and relationship with each other.
 
 In the past, Gabriel can be considered as a live-in-the-moment type of person. Though smarter than other boys his age, Gabriel shows no interest in school and tends to dismiss thoughts about serious future matters. He always asks his girlfriend, Agnes, to clope with him. Agnes, on the other hand, is a practical type of person. Working and studying hard in hopes of being able to go off somewhere better and be successful someday, Agnes always rejects Gabriel's proposal to clope. Their lives take a huge turn one night, when Gabriel makes a choice of being part of a hold-up where he accidentally kills someone.
 
 At present, Gabriel is a hitman who has grown more reserved and detached through the years. Nostalgic about his past, Gabriel longs and searches for Agnes, whom he hasn't met with since that night he first killed someone.
 
 The film functions as a way of presenting how choices made by people have effects in their life bigger and irreversible han they can immediately realize. Using flash forwards and flashbacks, this film focuses on choices and memory, showing that past choices and events can only be remembered and not changed. This film also features nostalgia as one of its main themes. With a continuous yearning for the past that can no longer be achieved, people end up settling for second best.
subject: HUMAN RELATIONS IN FILM
creator: Santiago, Cristina Sandel
castcrew: Santiago, Hector R; Santiago, Corazon S; Manatad, Carlo Francisco

title: Katipunan
description:
Abstract
 
 Soliongco, J.C.L. (2010) Katipunan, Unpublished Undergraduate Thesis, University of the Philippines, College of Mass Communication
 
 Katipunan is a short film that explores the undercurrents of history, memory, social responsibility, cynicism, heroism and love in the everyday lives of Filipino youths. It frames a hyperlink narrative focused on three main protagonists- an Atenean, a University of the Philippines Student Activist, and a blue collar worker, all in their early twenties, around the events before, immediately after, and a year after typhoon Ondoy (Ketsana) hits Manila.
 
 The film also draws parallelisms between Filipino Youths and Contemporary Philippine Cinema, in examining their contributions to mass society in the everyday and in the grand scheme of things.
subject: POLITICAL FILMS
creator: Soliongco, Jose Carlos Limjap
castcrew: Limjap, Marco; Tang, Thesa; Abrahan, Gian; Gomez, Maika; Lee, Samantha; Catbagan, Bianca; Quizon, Mikko

title: Apuhap
description:
Abstract
 
 Jayson, G. K. J. & Olivenza, P. A. A. (2011). Apuhap, Student Thesis, University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication
 
 This is a father-daughter story, about their differing perspectives on an important matter and how they separately deal with it. An 18 year old girl is pregnant. Fear of her father's reaction as well as the responsibility of becoming a mother motivates her to abort her unborn child. The 38 year old father suspicious of his daughter's actions learns of his daughter's problem. Initially furious and feeling betrayed, he eventually calms down, realizing that his daughter is his only family. Much like his daughter's struggle to talk to him, he faces the problem of reaching out to her.
 
 Our film, entitled Apuhap, is mainly about communication between fathers and daughters, that there comes a time in a girl's life, usually in the transition period from being a child to a teenager, when her father seems oblivious and distant, and that in the eyes of the father, his daughter has grown up and lesser experiences and stories could be shared with her. The concept of lack of communication between the father and daughter comes from our experiences with our fathers.
subject: ABORTION IN FILMS
creator: Jayson, Geva Krissa; Olivenza, Paulle
castcrew: Barrameda, Kristin; Manatad, Carlo Francisco; Mallari, Rivelle, Taduran, Jayvee Edward;

title: Anti rebel
subject: POLITICAL FILMS
creator: Mahinay, Ash
castcrew: Mahinay, Mike; Michelle Mahinay, Ian Guevara

title: Ruweda (Wheel)
description:
Abstract
 Raymundo, R.T. (2012). Reunion. Unpublished Undergraduate Thesis. University of the Philip-
 pines College of Mass Communication.
 Reunion is a narrative film that explores the integration of a deviant into society. The
 story is about a man who introduces his mistress to his family. The film's events occur on the day
 of their annual family reunion, which they hold in memory of their daughter who had died in a
 car accident several years past.
 The film is structured on the sociology of deviance, labeling theory and the psychology behind meeting strangers and confronting members of out-groups.
 Intended to call attention to how people pass judgment on others based on prevalent
 cultural stereotypes, the film is also an invite to open mindedness, acceptance and change.
creator: Espia, Hannah Tabitha Madrazo
castcrew: Lupac, Maita; Hipol,  Chuck; Mesina, Aleli; Simbulan, Grace; De Rivera, Jono

title: Sa rikaw
description: Sa Rikaw is a documentary that centers on the culture loss of the Iraya Mangyang community in Magnot, Barangay Balao, Abra de Ilog, Occidental Mindoro. The film shows the discontinued use of the Irayan language by the community and how it has affected their lives as an ethnic tribe. It documents the last Irayan song, Sa Rikaw, that the community knows. The framework used for the documentary is Cultural Hegemony. Antonio Gramsci explains that a multi-cultural society is dominated by a social class or dominant culture. Cultural Hegemony is evident in the Iraya community's current situation, the losing of the Iraya language, formal pubic school education, consumerism, effect of mass media and the losing of the only Iraya song left, Sa Rikaw.
subject: CULTURE AND THE CINEMA, ETHNIC GROUPS IN FILMS
creator: Limayo, Kathleen Lei P.
castcrew: Montero, Trisha Allysse; Limayo, Kath Lei; Cielo, Carlo; Martel, Frances Grace; Lozada, Theo; Lorenzo, Jillian

title: Sapantaha
description: Tatay Emong seems to be stuck in the memories of his love.  His son, Tim, will be facing an important moment of his life and he needs his father now more than anything in the word.
subject: HUMAN RELATIONS IN FILM
creator: Generoso, Ara
castcrew: Sulicipan, Daniel Brian; Filio, Chanelle; Manalaysay, Maycarlo; Barrameda, Kristin; Dela Cruz, Rosebell Mikaella Jeanne

title: Send-A-Klaus
description:
Abstract
 
 Olivera, A.B.S. (2013). Send-A-Klaus, Unpublished Undergraduate Thesis, University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication.
 
 This film is about the Secret Santa Society: a group of devoted Christmas enthusiasts from all over the world conspiring with the elves that live in the North Pole. Since Santa Claus has already died, the Secret Santa Society has brought it upon itself to revive and perpetuate the world's belief in Santa Claus. It has been starting gift-giving missions worldwide, following and simulating Santa's method.
 
 In this film, three new accomplices of the society are chosen to be sent on a test mission to the Philippines, which poses challenges on their procedures, on account of it being a different environment.
 
 The film deconstructs a child's role in creating traditions and ways of celebrating for a holiday that has been institutionalized and perpetualized by powers greater and older than him.
 
 This thesis paper questions and challenges the age-old Santa Claus tradition and explores its origins in order to deconstruct the perceived necessity for it and to examine its place in a truly equal relationship between adults and children in our world. It explores the origins of Christmas, its evolving nature and current state represented in media, and the involvement of power in communicating these concepts, and influencing belief, from both the holders of power in media to their audiences, and from adults to children.
 
 Using concepts taken from Piaget's stages of cognitive development and existentialist philosophy, this thesis analyses the current status of this yearly phenomenon, and conceptualizes a better treatment and understanding of children and tradition at this particular time of year.
subject: CHRISTMAS IN FILMS
creator: Olivera, Ana Bien Sofia
castcrew: Limayo, Kathleen 'Lei;

title: Ang buklod tao at ang barangay Banaba
description:
Abstract
 
 Mercado, M. V. DC. (2012) Ang Buklod Tao at ang Barangay Banaba, Unpublished 
 Student Thesis, University of the Philippines, College of Mass Communication 
 
 Disaster risks (i.e. typhoon, earthquakes etc.) affect various communities all over the Philippines at different extents. While these risk are mostly natural, their effect and impact could be cushioned with the proper kind or preparation, involvement of stakeholders, and high-level of consciousness among community members. “ Ang Buklod Tao at ang Barangay Banaba “ is a documentary that looks into the role being played by Buklod Tao, a people’s organization in the at-risk community of barangay Banaba. It illustrates how a community could be developed and organized even with the absence of government’s proactive involvement. Using the Hyogo Framework for Action. The film shows Buklod Tao’s capacity development and partnership with their local government towards building a resilient community; Participatory Hazard , Vulnerability, and Capacity Assessment on the other hand, helped contextualize the relationship of visual evidences shown in the film.
subject: STORMS IN FILMS
creator: Mercado, Michael Vincent
castcrew: Mercado, Tadeo; Mercado, Jessie

title: World ipis
description:
Abstract
 
 Barrameda, K. J. P. & Ubaldo, J. C. M. (2012). World Ipis, Unpublished Undergraduate Thesis, University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication.
 
 The film tells the story of a cockroach who becomes tired of being mistreated and killed by humans and decides to fight back. He persuades his fellow cockroaches to join his cause by telling them his plans on how to take revenge. However, his firm resolve proves to be insufficient, as an insecticide spray lurking from outside the crack ends his life.
 
 The filmmakers try to use the film as a reflection of society in terms of power struggle and prejudice against minority. In the film, the cockroaches become aware of the oppression that comes from the larger society and they decide to take action and change the system. But despite the awareness that they have, the larger part of the society makes change hard for them to realize. Likewise, marginalized sectors create efforts to free themselves and gain acceptance. However, the majority fails to understand and help them, thus they remain powerless.
 
 World Ipis explores how society constructs labels that limit people and hinder them from transcending restraints and achieving change. With the understanding of Social Construction of Reality and Labeling Theory, the filmmakers created a narrative that aims to illustrate how exterior factors such as imposed
subject: EMOTION IN FILMS
creator: Barrameda, Kristin Joyce Parreno, Athena Czarina Generoso & Joana Carla Martinez Ubaldo
castcrew: Barrameda, Dolcisimo at Melba; Ubaldo, Francisco at Yolenia; Espiritu, Anna Francesca; Barrameda, Kristin Joyce Parreno

title: Paglalayag
description: The OFW phenomenon has been a part of Philippine society. One popular form of overseas work for most Filipinos is seafaring. Paglalayag is a documentary that takes a look at the lives of a young and an old seafarer. The film explores the subjects' motivations in pursuing their careers as well as the effects that their profession has had on their personal lives. The goal of the documentary is to bring about the contrasting ideas about working overseas. It aims to ask the question if it is still wirth it. A portion of the documentary was shot onboard the DHL Pacific that sailed from China to Australia. The Filmmaker sent her camera to the crew onboard and gave directions via Internet and phone. Footage was sent to the filmmaker whenever possible. The subjects were then shot and interviewed by the filmmaker when they came home
subject: HUMAN RELATIONS IN FILM, SEA IN FILMS
creator: Gomez, Michaela
castcrew: Gomez, Alberto; Gomez, Nel; Escosura, Hannah; Soliongco, Caloy

title: Bitiw
description:
Abstract
  Delos Santos, J.M.T. (2012). Bitiw, Unpublished Student Thesis, University of the Philippines College of Mass Communication.
  Bitiw is about JM, a young physical therapist, who suffered a vehicular accident a year ago wherein he lost his best friend. He is then faced with the revelation that he has been unknowingly treating the hit and run drunk driver who collided with him that night. It is about the exhaustive journey of grief and guilt and how it all leads to a choice. In the end, he begins to show signs of acceptance as he momentarily sets antagonism aside and talks to the only person who can help him understand and eventually recover - his patient.
  The film is psychological in nature and explores internal struggles centered on the dynamics of a car accident. Bitiw borrows tenets of psychoanalytic theory, like defense mechanisms, and Goffman's Frame Analysis while exemplifying the existence of perspective, degree and choice in acceptance and letting go.
subject: HUMAN RELATIONS IN FILM
creator: Delos Santos, Jenine Marielle
castcrew: Delos Santos, Jennifer Anne; Delos Santos, Johnny; Delos Santos, Jenine Marielle; Morales, Jerome
